_prev_prog_3.PC_OtherType: In-line excess flow automatic shut-down valves
_prev_prog_3.MD_OtherType: routine visual inspection by trained operators
_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: Nh3 tanks, lines and Nh3 trailers and hoses
_prev_prog_3.Description: United Suppliers, Inc--Hastings, NE is a wholesale farm supply company.  The site uses anhydrous ammonia supplied from storage tanks or rail car to supply ammonia to a portable pipe reactor operation, on a periodic basis.  10-34-0 is produced at this facility and liquid fertilizer is loaded out at this facility.   In addtion to updating process hazard assessments, emphasis is placed on routine employee training and adherence to specific operations and maintenance procedures.   Close contact is maintained with the LEPC and other local agencies.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The United Suppliers, Inc--Hastings, Ne operation is committed to employee, public and environmental safety.  This commitment is demonstrated by continually improving both practices and measures to prevent the release of regulated substances.  In the event of a release, the Hastings facility is prepared to work with the Adams Co LEPC  and/or other authorities to mitigate any release and minimize the impact ot people and the environment.

The Hasting facility's primary covered process activity is the mixing of fertilizers.  These activities include storage and processing of anhydrous ammonia.  Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored and processed into 10-34-0 non-hazardous liquid fertilizer.  Processing is periodic thruout the year.  Ammonia mixing with phosphoric acid occurs in a T-reactor.  Water is used as both a reaction feed material and product stablizer.  The Emergency Response Procedures for Hastings are coordinated with the Adams Co LEPC.

United Suppliers, Inc--Hastings Ne has taken the necessary steps to comply with acidental release prevention requirements set forth in 40 CFR Part 68.  Hastings is also covered by OSHA's Process Safety management standard.  The following briefly describes the prevention program elements in place at this stationary source.

Process Safety Information: The facility maintains information describing the chemical hazards, operating parameters and equipment designs associated with the covered process.

Process Hazard Analysis:  Studies are conducted to ensure the hazards associated with process operations are identified, understood and controlled.

Operating Procedures:  Written operating procedures are maintained for covered process oeprations.  The Contractors procedures address the following activities:  Initial startup, normal, temporary, emergency shutdown, normal shutdown, startup following a turnaround, and startup after emergency shutdown.

Hot Work Permits:  In order to assure adequate controls are used in work where cond

itions could cause ignition of flammable  combustible materials, the Hot Work Permit System will be utilized.  Hot work involves any welding, soldering, cutting, grinding, drilling, or any type of work where sparks may occur during operation.  These permits will utilized where the supervisor deems them necessary for job safety.  It will be the supervisor's responsibility to ensure the proper procedures are followed and keep the appropriate records.  

Training:  A program is in place to ensure employee(s) are knowledgeable and trained in procesures associated with the covered processes.  Verification of Contractor training has been documented.

Mechanical Integrity:  Covered process equipment is maintained consistent with generally accepted engineering practices.  Covered process equipment is routinely inspected and tested.  Maintenance activities are conducted by qualified personnel.  Deficiencies are corrected in a timely manner.

Management of Change:  Written procedures are in place to manage changes in process chemicals, technology, equipment, and/or procedures.  Affected personnel are informed and trained to deal with authorized system changes.

Pre-Startup Review:  Technical and operational reviews will be conducted on new processes and/or modifications to existing covered processes.  Reviews confirm the construction, equipment, operations and maintenance procedures are suitable.  Reviews are completed prior to placing equipment in operation

Compliance Audits:  Internal audits are conducted on a regular basis to determine whether the provisions specified under the RMP rule are being implemented.  At a minimum, thes audits are conducted every there (3) years.  Any determined corrective actions are completed in a timely manner.

Incident Investigations:  Investigations are conducted to determine the root cause of covered process incidents.  In addition to determination and correction, investigations are directed toward preventing reoccurence.  Investigations b

ecome process safety information are retained for five (5) years.  United Suppliers, Inc Risk Management department resides at Eldora Ia, providing additional inciden investigation support.

Employee Participation:  United Suppliers, Inc.-Hastings Ne employee(s) actively contribute in the following:  process hazard assessments, operating procedure development, maintenance procedure development, training development and implementation, pre-startup reviews, incident investigations, and compliance audits.  Additionall, employee(s) have access to all information pertaining to the facility;s RMP.

Contractors:  Periodically, Hastings Ne. may hire contractors to conduct specialized operations, maintenance and construction activities.  Prior to work, contractors are trained on the covered processes, relevant process safety information and emergency response actions.

Five (5) Year Accident History:  There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five (5) years that have resulted in deaths, injuries or significant property damage.  Nor to our knowledge, has there been any releases resulting off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, property damage and/or environmental damage.

Emergency Action Plan:  United Suppliers, Inc- Hastings, Ne has a written emergency action plan.  This plan includes notification of the Adams Co LEPC.  Local authorities have been provided with emergency planning and community right-to-know information.

Planned changes to improve safety:  United Suppliers, Inc.-Hastings, Ne views safety improvement as a continual process.  Periodic evaluations (both internal and external) are performed to assess the facility status.  At this time, and aside from sustaining maintenance activities, there are no additional specific safety recommendations regarding anhydrous ammonia.
